lead_paragraph: The problem of American policy toward Finland is a peculiarly delicate and difficult one. We are likely to see its solution more clearly, however, if we separate as far as possible its military and its moral aspects. Finland's war against Russia helps Hitler. It enables him to economize German troops and equipment; it forces Russia to divert more of its own troops and equipment that could be used against Hitler.
